elements.name: question1
elements.title: What distinguishes the basic range from the additional range?
elements.correctAnswer: The basic assortment contains goods from the usual product range, which make up the majority of sales. The additional assortment rounds off the basic assortment.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: What is the difference between a wide and a narrow range?
elements.correctAnswer: A broad assortment includes goods from many sectors; a narrow assortment includes goods from one or two sectors.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: What characteristics should a good location for a retail business have?
elements.correctAnswer: Large potential customer base, high purchasing power of customers, few competing businesses, good accessibility (transport links), good quality premises with low rents, good sales opportunities

elements.name: question4
elements.title: What is the difference between an offensive and a defensive pricing policy?
elements.correctAnswer: In an aggressive pricing policy, companies try to enforce their own price expectations. If the prices are higher than those of the competition, this is known as a high-price policy. If the prices are lower than those of the competition, this is a low-price policy. In a defensive pricing policy, the retailer adjusts its prices to those of the competition.

elements.name: question5
elements.title: What types of sales can be distinguished?
elements.correctAnswer: Full service/consultation, pre-selection by the customer, self-service
